'Good' Peer Reviewer.description: are responsible to find the strengths of the paper, everything that would be important for the paper to be accepted for a conference.

'Mean' Peer Reviewer.description: are responsible to find all the weaknesses of the paper: what is wrong, what could be improved and why they should not be accepted for a conference.

Archaeologist.description: are responsible to look on the references and dig knowledge out of that huge massive network, providing one paper that influenced and one that was influenced by the paper being discussed.

Developer.description: are responsible for looking for / creating code, tutorials that implement the paper or that are related in any other way.

Entrepreneur.description: are responsible for looking for / coming up with applications and products for these new techniques, present them or making a pitch for them.

Journalist.description: are responsible for checking authors backgrounds and/or the way this paper has been discussed on the media in general, looking for gossip.

Attendee.description: you haven't had the time to go through the paper but want to join or simply watch the discussion

Mediator.description: are responsible for collecting all the information and mediating the discussion.
